ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Main activities:  Agriculture development.  Infrastructure development including education, health, sanitation and nutrition promotion at the village level.  Self help group promotion.  Promotion of participatory theatre for change  Intervention to develop model village  Forest protection and NTFP marketing.  Children rights and entitlements  Women development and empowerment  Pachayati Raj  Health and family welfare Achievements: IAEET has been taking up suitable strategies in the field of natural resource management, functional education and rural technology to bring about a transformation of the face of the area. Agriculture and forestry are the main sources of livelihood of the people. IAEET has tried to convert the subsistence nature of farming by integrating the traditional methods with special methods of organic cultivation, which includes SRI (System of Rice Intensification, vermin composting) in the region. We are also facilitating the promotion of various cash crops such as Ginger, Turmeric, Onion, Garlic and off-season vegetables. IAEET is also promoting mushroom cultivation as livelihood support for the rural masses and facilitating its marketing in these Districts. IAEET believes that unless people are awakened and empowered, little development in the true sense of the term can take place. So, the main work of IAEET has been to put more ideas into peoples heads before they work wholeheartedly with their hands; and this has been done by our Community Based Theatre as a means of transmitting feelings and ideas. This area is blessed with a varied and abundant forest resources particularly the minor forest produces ,our organization has been facilitating participatory forest management and we are also trying to provide marketing linkage so that the people would get an alternative source of income. Besides, IAEET has also been facilitating different programmes not only in the form of delivery of services but also as a catalytic agent of development in conformity with the tribal philosophy and psychology. Moreover, it has been mobilizing resources for awarding an alternative basis of social security in the long run. IAEET in order to bring about gender equity in the region has constituted the Women Self Help Groups (WSHGs) as the agents of change and promoted these groups in its action area and we further hope to empower the women groups by providing them with a platform to carry out their small businesses

JD Centre of Art is a non-commercial institution based in the ancient temple city of Bhubaneshwar, Odisha, the East coast of India. Although it is based in Odisha, it will reach out to the National and International art world. JDCAs aim is to further the cause of traditional and contemporary, visual and plastic arts. The approach of JDCA is holistic- bringing together tribal, folk, classical and contemporary art forms under one roof.The JDCA Film Forum is one of the major activity conducted.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: 1. For implementation of Forestry Sector Development Project in Lamtaput and Nandapur, we worked with 98 Vana Samrakhyana Samities. The VSSs were promoted and capacitated by us to restore, generate and protect the village forest. 2. We have been working with 31 Village Development Committees (VDCs) for ensuring rights and entitlements under various schemes of both State and Central Government. These VDCs were promoted to act as a catalyst for good governance and social justice. 3. We are also working with 21 Disable Peoples Organisation in Lamtaput Block covering 7 Gram Panchayats. The DPOs are advocating with government line departments for rights and entitlements. 4. We are working directly with 117 SHGs being promoted by us covering 9 GPs of Lamtaput Block towards promoting income generating activities and plans. 5. We have also promoted one Micro-Hydro Power Committee, which is looking after day to day running, repairing and maintaining the MHP installed in their village. We have successfully rehabilitated 2 Micro Hydro power plants with 50 KW production capacity in Semiliguda block of the district. Successfully implemented the Child reporters process in Koraput district with a coverage of 650 schools across all 14 blocks, which has been later on adopted by department of School and Mass Education, government of Odisha. successfully demonstrated the Line sowing and line transplanting of Paddy and Ragi (major staple food of tribal communities) in Lamtaput block and Koraput block. Developed entrepreneurs in for running of 2 enterprise units in MHP villages to run and manage the rice hawler, floor mill and turmeric processing units for sustainability of MHPs. Successfully completed the demonstration of 4000 hectors of finger millet programme in partnership with Agricultural Technology and Management Agency (ATMA)

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Education (Non-Formal,Formal,Adult Education, Pre School,Adult Education), Community Health, Sustainable Agriculture, Vocational Skills Training, House Upgradation, Micro finance, Local Self Government, Environment and Forest, Gender, Capacity Building, Youth Activities : Youths of Jeypore in Koraput District from diverse faith and professional background having fire to do something for the development of the society, got themselves organized under the banner of Social Action Group later registered as LEAD to help youth productively participate in the development process. Vocational skills training programmes on driving-cum-mechanic, type-writing, tailoring have benefited 820 nos. of youth of Koraput District.  Educational Complex, LEAD, Sundiguda Educational Complex  a special scheme (under the 8th Five Year Plan Programme of the Govt) launched by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Govt. of India, New Delhi through NGOs in the pockets where tribal women literacy rate is less than 10%, with the purpose to increase literacy rate of tribal women. In an academic session 150 tribal girls study primary education (Class I to Class V) in LEAD, Sundiguda village under Badniput Panchayat of Jeypore Block in Koraput District of Orissa State in India. The girls besides, formal education also get education on preserving and developing of indigenous culture, sustainable agriculture, environment, vocational skills. A success story of Educational Complex, LEAD, Sundiguda Dalimbo Jani, d/o Muguri Jani (aged 46 years) and Rasai Jani (aged 42 years) passed the High School Certificate (HSC) Examination, conducted by Board of Secondary Education, Odisha and created history by way of being the first Kondho tribe girl from Odisha to secure first division marks in the HSC examination 2006. The tribals of Koraput in general and Kondho tribe in particular feel proud of her achievement. The Chief Minister of Odisha, Shri Nabin Pattnaik has sent a congratulation message to Ms. Dalimbo. On 5th June 2006, Ms. Dalibo was felicitated in a public function organized by State Welfare Board, Orissa. All the local dailies of the District and even the State have highlighted her success story. The local television channel E TV and Radio interviewed Dalimbo and broadcasted. Responding to the result Dalimbo states that had there been no school in LEAD, Sundiguda it would not have been possible for me to achieve the rare feat since the school provides the first generation learners the required motivation for schooling. The 5th class pass out students from Educational Complex, LEAD, Sundiguda continue their high school study in different High Schools of the district having hostel facility and even studying in colleges and doing professional courses like engineering, nursing, teaching.
